Reviews.Title: “Very Good value”
Reviews.Author: ExpertComptable
Reviews.Content: Nice surprise to find helpful and positive staff and great value. The suites have a small well equipped kitchen, ensuite bedroom, large reception room and visitor's washroom. With Internet and breakfast included in the price this was really good value. Room service is available but no alcohol is served in the hotel, bring your own from duty free.There was a local (inexpensive) restaurant nearby and the hotel also had an adequate restaurant. A supermarket and drug store were close and then there is the rest of Dubai open as anywhere else. Taxis are easy if you ask the staff to get one, but may take a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Mohi_Khater
Reviews.Content: Stayed on several occasions (Business and Overnight stay). The Hotel Apartment offers 1 Bedroom and 2 Bedrooms apartment. F&B facilities are still poor. It needs more facilities. As all the Hotel Apartments in Dubai no Alcohol is served. Close to the airport. Location is very good if the work is in Sharjah or Qusasis area. There are several restaurants and supermarkets surrounding the area. Hospitals are also close to the hotel. Al Mamzar Beach is not far away from the hotel. Good value of money. However, we must understand the location and distance first before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel. Decent furnished apartments.”
Reviews.Author: mniee
Reviews.Content: Not bad if you need a base for a month or so. Not worth it for short term visits. Expect a spacious and clean apartment but not hotel service. Location is good only if you work in Sharjah or Northern Deira. Lots of traffic though. You'll need a car to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY BUT FAR FROM MAIN ATTRACTIONS”
Reviews.Author: Alexlondon1977
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bed apt for 4 nights.The rate agreed for room only was quite decent at 450 DHS per night ( Excluding bfast).We arrived quite late at 10 pm and asked to be shown a few rooms before making up our mind and eventually settled for room 1011 with a balcony on master bedroom overlooking the main road but not noisy. I was a bit annoyed that the receptionist kept asking us to settle the bill even before we went to the room.What if I didn't like the hotel after our first night? Decor was neutral and overall rooms are nicely furnished if not a bit tired . I wasn't overly impressed with their linen or towels as they looked very frailed and hard at touch. Kitchen was nice size and had microwave, kettle, medium size fridge and a wash drier wich was quite handy with young kids.Only problem was that the fuse kept blowing out when I was attempting to iron and run the w/machine at the same time. I was happy with the cleaniness as the room always smelled nice when we came back from our travelling and on a couple of occasions we let the cleaners enter when we were still in the apt and I saw many cleaning products in their trolley . They do not have a swimming poolunlike what I read on previous reviews. They have a small gym on 1st floor but we didn't visit it. The hotel offers free internet access but it isn't wireless and actually proved to be a pain .Every day we had to call reception to get a new log in password and also the speed is so slow..like watching paint dry...very annoying!!!! The location is nowhere near Dubai downtown.You must have a car to reach every turist attraction and unfortunately the traffic is horrible.You have to plan your day starting from 9-10 am.If you hit the road earlier than that you must take into consideration a huge rush hours traffic jam and plenty of queueing.Same in the evening around 5-7 pm. If it wasn't for the value for money I would have stayed somewhere closer to town. It doesn't feel central at all..plenty of sandy empty lots and busy roads is all you will see from the balcony but if you are lucky u might catch sight of the Burj Khalifa at night!!! We were recommended this hotel by our nephew who lives in Sharjia.I guess having family in Dubai makes this hotel value for money cause eventually we visited them a lot but if u come to Dubai on a holiday adventure with young kids I wouldn't mind paying a little extra but be closer to the action!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DunesTunes
Reviews.Content: We advise if anyone wants value for money,then we suggest not staying at this hotel.Calling for service from this hotel, is never easy.You need to call the front desk for several times before someone can attend to you. Full of craps and sloppy reasons they will give you, each time you call. The location are fine. It is so near and fast to get to the airport. Various restaurants around. The most popular supermarket is Carrefour Express,couple blocks away from the hotel. All of needs for goceries and other daily needs can be found in this supermarket. We heard some locals like going to Al Madina Supermarket and West supermarket.There are two hospitals.One is Zulaika Hospital and the other is NMC Hospital which is next to the hotel. They were good to us when we first arrive.After months of staying with them,they give us such a bad treatment. For the record, the filipinos guys n gals give extra attention and hospitality to the middle east people,especially the men. But if you are from any other nationality beside the Gulf or the Middle East, then look out. There will give you limited attention and hospitality. One good example are us. We get fewer and fewer attention from them,each day for the last 3 months we been there with them. So we suggest you guys avoid the heartache and go somewhere for your accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Al Nahda and Al Qusais area”
Reviews.Author: neeraj1742
Reviews.Content: Our company booked this hotel for us to stay for a week. We are 2 persons. Hotel is the best in this category. With swimming pool at the top. Fully furnished rooms. LCD's euipped with lot of channels. Full entertainment because downstarins of the hotel couple of Billiards and Pool centers are established by different owners. Near to the glossary stores. So if you are gping to stay in the hotel no need to go any where for anything. Everything is in your reach. Just do your business work form your laptop with full comfort. If want to explore dubai just ask reception people, they have good tie-up's with tour organisers.

Reviews.Title: “A place for transient with hourly rates!”
Reviews.Author: jack_bull_usa
Reviews.Content: "A place for transient with hourly rates!" This is how the taxi driver that the hotel called referd to this hotel. Definitely, not a place to take your family. The hotel is not a four star, may be two or three if you push it. It is a in a dusty edge of Dubai and far from everything (on the border with Sharjah. The hotel's lobby is filed with south Asian migrant workers and not really suited for couples or families! Mine refused to stay and we had to forget about the first night that they charged as we left this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised...”
Reviews.Author: rarero
Reviews.Content: We were a bit tired after arriving in Dubai at 2am and being taken to the wrong hotel by the taxi driver. After being told that this hotel was a bit out near the airport we were slightly reluctant to take the trip. We walked in the door and there was a friendly smiling face waiting for us. The check in was quick and smooth. When we walked through the halls to our two bedrooms apartment everything looked and smelled brand new. We opened the door and we were blown away by how large and beautifully furnished and arranged our place for three nights were. The living room was beautiful, each bedroom had its own full bathroom,an extra half bath in the hall next to a laundryroom with a combo washer/dryer,and a huge full kitchen. We thought we had hit the jackpot. Our fears were put to rest and we relaxed and had a wonderful time there. Free buffet breakfast daily and the shuttle took us to MALL OF EMIRATES as requested. I would definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: 1punjabi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worthy a 4 star rating, upon arrival they forgot to send a driver at the airport, so we waited 30 mins, after begging to use a phone at the airport, then there were no appologies, room was not up to standard, shoddy paint/ finishes, wonky tiles, no balconie! as they advertised, taxi service was terrible, have to croos a busy sandy road, breakfast is a free for all,so called resteraunt is a basic room with plates of food, i have been to dubai 5 times & never seen flies in dubai hotels , but come here and you will in the food area! NO BAR! , staff were polite, but thats the best point, i won't go back there, reccomend oasis beach hotel, hilton, metropolitan, to name a few, I BOOKED THROUGH EXPEDIA, next time i'll stick to best at dubai holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Didnt live up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: saalihaAlAin
Reviews.Content: This hotel should NOT be rated a 4 - star. I have paid less and had better services from many other hotels. A week before arriving at the hotel I emailed them and requested a baby cot. I said i was willing to bring our travel cot if they didnt have any. I was reassured that there would be a cot available and not to worry. I was also told breakfast was complimentary. Well, we arrived at the hotel on the 20th March and noticed that the hotel was somewhat overcrowded and that reception were not particularly welcoming. Our two-bedroom suite was on the 12th floor which we didnt mind, and was really the highlight of our stay. We had every comfort we needed in our suite and the state of furniture/decor was perfect. In fact it was the best suite we ever stayed in. The kitchen had every facility and provision - just as we would have in our own home (minus the food of course ;) HOWEVER, there was no baby cot. In fact no cot arrived even though i kept being assured one was on its way. in fact, a mattress turned up at 1am at night, with my toddler happily bouncing around for most of the night. It was really upsetting. The hotel now admitted there were no cots available, and insisted that i should be happy with the mattress especially as they werent charging me for it. WELL, a baby cot would have been complimentary anyway, so yes it should be free at no extra charge. The next morning we went down to breakfast - and what a disappointement. no plates left, no cutlery, no juice, no tea and barely any food. Many people were left disappointed as there really wasnt anything to eat. After I complained and threatened to take it up with the manager, they started to send in some scraps, but by then we were really put off. The hotel was not at the standard of a 4 star. in terms of service - very poor, probably 1 or 2 maximum. the suite was very nice and yes probably 4 star. You need to decide which is more important. Personally I will not return there again, even though we had the perfect suite. The hotel is on a building site and while we heard no noise, the surroundings arent very pleasant. A very nice restaurant just down the road - Karachi Durbar that sells asian food at good prices. As for the hotel, i would not recommend it. The staff need to be trained in customer satisfaction and be more welcoming to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: tlindema
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated 4 stars hotel. In my opinion 3 stars is max. Service was slow and Hotels restaurant was awfull. Gym was small and there was no pool. In march 2008 hotel was located in the middle of construction site.

HotelInfo.Name: Emirates Stars Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: between Amman and Baghdad streets | PO Box 86880, Dubai 86880, United Arab Emirates
